com.github.fge.filesystem.driver

Class UnixLikeFileSystemDriverBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.filesystem.driver.FileSystemDriverBase
      • com.github.fge.filesystem.driver.UnixLikeFileSystemDriverBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystemDriver, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public abstract class UnixLikeFileSystemDriverBase
extends FileSystemDriverBase
    A base abstract implementation of a FileSystemDriver for Unix-like filesystems

    In addition to the defaults defined in FileSystemDriverBase, this abstract class defaults to a UnixPathElementsFactory for building paths and a default PathMatcherProvider to provide PathMatcher instances -- therefore bringing support for both "glob" and "regex" path matchers. It also considers that all paths whose last name element begin with a dot are hidden (overridable).

    • Method Detail

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden(Path path)
                 throws IOException
        Tell whether a path is to be considered hidden by this filesystem

        Typically, on Unix systems, it means the last name element of the path starts with a dot (".").

        Parameters:
        path - the path to test
        Returns:
        true if this path is considered hidden
        Throws:
        IOException - filesystem level error, or a plain I/O error
        See Also:
        FileSystemProvider.isHidden(Path)
